headline: Seafood Fettuccine
description: This impressive seafood Alfredo recipe with shrimp, scallops, and fettuccine pasta is bound to rival your favorite restaurant's version of the same dish!
name: Seafood Fettuccine
recipeIngredient: 1 pound medium shrimp - peeled and deveined

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.

Meanwhile, melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in green onions and garlic; cook for 1 minute. Stir in shrimp and scallops; cook for 3 minutes, then reduce the heat to medium-low.

Pour in half-and-half and season with salt and pepper; stir constantly and bring to a simmer, making sure it does not boil. Gradually stir in 1/2 cup Parmesan; cook and stir for 1 more minute, then remove from the heat.
Drain pasta. Add to the skillet and toss with sauce until thoroughly coated. Sprinkle remaining Parmesan over top and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I made it for dinner and just followed the recipe and it turned out delicious. I should have added more broccoli and mushrooms

I pretty much totally changed the recipe by using couscous instead of fettuccine, no heavy cream but added One pack of soft feta, (it's hard to find parsley here so substituted w cilantro) and only used shrimp. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!
This was easy n delicious! I only used shrimp. Will make again

First off, restaurant or better style delicious. Depending on your preferences I used a little more parmesan, exactly the right amount of half and half. Used double the butter and had a drizzle of olive oil in the pan(I'm not trying to eat healthy). It did take a dab of the corn starch which may not be necessary (I like mine thick). Everything about this recipe is a perfect do it yourself, follow exactly or veer off a bit and get creative but it's an awesome recipe for just about anyone, new or experienced cook-at-home folks. Thanks!

This was a big hit for our family's New Year's Eve dinner. Due to diet restrictions, I used a 12oz box of gluten-free pasta and it turned out to be a good amount for the sauce. I used a total of 2 lbs of seafood, using a combination of shrimp, scallops, and a couple of cod filets. Based on other reviews, I added some portobello mushrooms and bell pepper but otherwise stuck to the existing recipe (including adding 1 tbsp cornstarch with the half&half).
Wonderful and easy

Perfect as is! The only thing I did was add crumbled bacon and chopped broccoli (so we could at least pretend it was healthy lol), but it would have been perfect without! 10/10 will totally make again.

My husband loved it just with shrimp! Definitely a 5 star. A few minor additions, after reading the reviews. I sautéed fresh mushrooms in the butter and garlic until soft then added the green onions and 1 tsp. Italian seasoning. Adding the shrimp I sautéed for 2 min on ea side. Then I removed the shrimp from the pan, preventing further cooking. Then I cont w the remaining recipe. It’s really delicious and can be very versatile. Thank you for sharing.
this is extremely good. I have never had scallops before & I was worried about this but it came out better than I thought.b
Great tasting Alfredo sauce. I added tiger shrimp and scallops. Great tasting and so easy to make. Will definitely make this again.
An awesome recipe. I added a little cajun spice to it to make Cajun Alfredo

Flavor was really good. My sauce came out a little thin. I did use fat free half and half, so maybe that was the problem. I added some corn starch, but didn't want to cook it too long and have overcooked seafood. Next time I will add the cornstarch earlier. Thanks for the recipe!
Yummmm

I made it with linguine instead.
Quick, simple and served with garlic bread. Loved It!!

I used everyone else’s suggestion and used heavy whipping cream. I had clams and crab meat on hand so I added that as well (scallops weren't available at the grocery store) to the shrimp. It worked out very well with the children too.
I added sautéed mushrooms & a few cherry tomatoes to the sauce. I used a little bit of flour (didn’t have corn starch) to thicken it. Complete Yum-Fest!! I’ll be making this again.
Made it. Was delicious. All I added to it was 1tsp Italian seasoning. My family loved it! Thank you
It was great! Didn't take long to prepare & the family loved it. I will be making it again!
This recipe is absolutely delicious. My only variation was preparing gluten free and some of my favorite spices which added a kick!

I made a few small tweaks to suit our tastes. Omitted onion, because we didn't have it. I did add a little nub of cream cheese that was nearing the expiry date. I also replaced scallops with krab. It was very tasty, and I will definitely make it again.

We used 6 cloves of garlic and kept adding Parmesan cheese until we got the sauce to desired consistency. We’re on a ketogenic diet, so substituted heavy whipping cream for half-n-half and used zucchini noodles for pasta. Delicious!
Best ever add additional garlic and less pasta also extra half pound of shrimp
This was so easy to make and delicious to eat last night. I've only omitted the green onions since I didn't have any. I didn't need to add the cornstarch either. I would make this again.
I agree with others that the sauce is very bland. I added 1/2 cup white cooking wine and some garlic salt in addition to the salt and pepper. Also added broccoli, tomatoes, and spinach
Green onions did not add anything to this dish, some fresh basil and oregano would have made it taster

I added Asiago cheese - I did add 1 tbs cornstarch to thick but in retrospect I think I should have waited because the sauce thickened too much I need to add more water and cream - I also cooked it all too early before my guests arrived and it went cold so had to reheat but everyone enjoyed it - had to add a bit more salt and one guest had 2 servings !! So it was very good in spite of my mistakes

Made this for my father’s birthday, after he raved for months about a dinner exactly like this that he’d had at a local restaurant. I doubled up on the shrimp, as Kroger had given me a free bag. (Sadly, no free scallops) This makes a simply stunning amount of food, but that is in no way a complaint - it freezes beautifully! Definitely making this again soon!!!!
So good! Didn’t change a thing.
this dish is easy and very good I made it for the family everyone enjoyed it I definitely recommend it

This recipe is a keeper, I did tweek it based on some comments so I added a shallot, a half a cup of wine and a 1/4 tsp of red pepper flakes. I did use cornstarch because I prefer a thicker consistency. So delicious!
Turned out great! I used a bag of frozen mixed...mussels, shrimp, crab and clams. Will definitely make again!
Very yummy!!
Family favorite. So delicious, quick and easy.

This recipe was delicious! I used heavy whipping cream instead of half and half. I would definitely recommend adding the cornstarch. It gave the sauce a perfect consistency and was very creamy. Will add this to my favorites.
Definitely will make again. Didn't have half and half so I used light cream. My husband enjoyed. I did throw some crushed red pepper in for some flavor.

With some changes in the cooking instruction it's a solid 5. I cut the portions back to 2, lunch tomorrow...can't wait! I can only get frozen scallops where I live so I soaked them in milk for 20 minutes to remove the "fishy" taste. While the pasta was cooking I pan seared the scallops and then the shrimp, scallops are too delicate IMHO to risk over cooking. I cooked the pasta for exactly 8 minutes and retained 3/4 cup of the cooking liquid before draining. Add the pasta and cooking liquid to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes. The corn starch is unnecessary, the starchy water replaces it. I then added the scallops and shrimp and cooked it just enough to warm. I had about a cup of extra clams and mussels so included this for the last minute. This will be a repeat, thanks for the recipe.
Easy and delicious. The scallops give it an air of eloquence, but it would probably be good with just the shrimp also.
I added lobster and 3 cups half and half. I also added a cup of mozzarella cheese to make it creamier. It was absolutely delicious. Thank you

This is a great recipe. I tried to follow the instructions verbatim, with the exception of extra garlic and cheese. I used dried cilantro cause I mistakenly thought I had no fresh on hand. As recommended, I added some corn meal to thicken the sauce. I used some monster shrimp and sea scallops. I'm not a pasta afficianado, but this was very tasty and apparently lighter than most recipes. A real crowd pleaser.
This one is a simple winner. It is delicious and perfect for a weeknight dinner.

This was truly the best seafood pasta I have had. My husband loves it and requests it once a week. I added roasted lobster tail, scallops, calamari rings and scaled back on the amount of shrimp. It was perfect! Thank you so much for the recipe!
Made it and then put the tomatoes in like another person posted they did and I think that made it perfect!
Easy to make and Everyone loved it!
This is SO good and easy. I have made this so many times for company. I do add mushrooms but that is a personal preference..I put mushrooms in everything (lol).

First off I used heavy cream and added mushrooms, but those were the only changes. I used Shrimp and Scallops it was very flavorful. The wife likes seafood and thought the recipe was very good. Everything came together well in this simple recipe. I will be using again and with different combinations as well.

Really enjoyed making this dish. I substituted the scallops with crawfish. Making the alfredo sauce was a little challenging but realized that the corn starch was a must instead of optional to thicken up the sauce. My family really enjoyed me using the recipe. I will be using it again.

VERY BLAND! I was looking for a recipe for seafood alfredo. I added more salt, pepper and one more clove of garlic than it called for and STILL lacking taste. I won't be using this recipe again but thank you for posting. I'm not sure what I could've done differently to give it more flavor.
this was so so good..I was out of source cream so I used cream cheese instead...it was a huge hit...for sure the best recipe for enchiladas I've ever used...thank you for sharing...
Great tasting. Easy and quick to make.
I made this tonight for dinner. Quick and easy to make. My husband loved it. This will be my go to recipe, thanks for sharing.
First time I've ever made anything like it. Turned out perfect. I steamed clams and added to the prawns at the end
Add a touch of nutmeg and BOOM .......PERFECT
Such an easy, yet delicious recipe! My teen aged daughters loved this!

Prepared the Seafood Alfredo Fettuccine for tonite's dinner; it was fantastic and quite easy. I tweaked it a bit by adding a few extra ingredients: a splash of lemon juice, a few shakes of crushed red pepper and two chopped snow crab clusters. I had to substitute one tablespoon of finely diced onion and chopped parsley for the chopped green onion. Will make sure there are green onions in the fridge the next time I make this recipe. Yep, received positive comments from hubby (not atypical). Thanks!! Sorry there is not a picture, but it was quite colorful and looked terrific.

I made this for a repast and it was delish. I did switch it up a bit. I added several veggies, OK a bunch of veggies (squash, zucchini, asparagus, carrots & broccoli)to give it a healthier twist (plus I love them), white wine & Dijon mustard. A friend recommended the last two ingredients. I cooked the scallops & shrimp as directed and added about 1/4 c wine and used the left over juice in the cream sauce and addes the Dijon mustard into the sauce also . Fantastic. Just made so much that there wasn't quite enuff sauce but it was soo good. Next time, more sauce.

Great! I followed the recipe closely but did not bother with the corn starch. I also used garlic salt instead of garlic as we don't like an overpowering garlic flavor. I added capers which were wonderful. I served broccoli and baby spinach with it. It could have been added in. All in all the meal was delicious and I would make it again.

Made this dish for my family and added a few extras . After rinsing the scallops and shrimp ( which I added) I seasoned the seafood with the salt , pepper, red peppers flakes and parsley. The seafood was then sautéed in the butter/garlic. When I added the cream ( used light cream) I also poured in some white wine. I felt the cornstarch amount was great and added the right amount of creaminess to the sauce. I will most definitely make this dish again.
My family really liked it! This was super rich even with using half and half instead of heavy cream. I added some heat with red pepper flakes. Great recipe!

This is a good starter recipe but it needs flavor. I added an extra clove of garlic, chopped bell pepper, onion and canned sliced artichokes. I also added a few tablespoons of cooking wine and used a fresh seafood mix (squid, octopus, shrimp, scallops and lobster). And at the end season liberally with salt, pepper and old bay.
This is a great base. I gave 4 stars as i added a bunch of stuff, lemon juice, hot pepper flakes, and used whipping cream instead of half and half. But it gives you the right idea of portions.

Not a great recipe. It lacked flavor and the sauce was soupy and thin. I was surprised it had such great ratings after I made it and I'm a really good cook. I'm sure you can take the basics and add more flavor and make it better. But I won't be making this again.
I added 3 pieces crisp bacon! It was delicious!! My 8 year old son couldn't stop praising me for how good it was!!!!

This was so easy, my 20 year old daughter actually made this, and it turned out great. We followed the recipe with two exceptions. We substituted chicken for the seafood. I'm looking forward to making it myself with shrimp and scallops. We also added some mushrooms, they were in the fridge.

I tweaked the recipe a bit as our family likes more flavor, after adding butter to fry up scallops & shrimp I added white truffle oil and chicken broth powder mix, garlic powder. I also used more parmesan cheese, and had to use constarch to thicken the sauce. Turned out amazing, I made enough to feed 10 people. There was 3 adults 2 kids eating, I only had 1 plate leftover!

This was Delish! It was so quick to throw together! It was creamy delisiousness...:) Restaurant quality! My sauce came out very flavorful and thickened up Beautifully! I did add more parmasan cheese but just my own personal preference!! Make this! It certainly wont dissapoint!

Seriously restaurant quality with just a couple tweeks. I added chopped roasted red peppers (from a jar) to the very end of the cooking process. I didn't want the sauce to turn pink! I also added fresh mushrooms to the green onion saute along with a splash of marsala wine to the sauce and divided heavy cream with half half & half. DELICIOUS!

we enjoyed making this. was soooo easy remember to stir without leaving unattended used 18 percent mf cream.
and spaghetti noodles a little cornstarch

Absolutely delish. I substituted whole grain penne pasta added 5 gloves of garlic, red pepper flakes and red cayenne pepper to taste and a cup of spinach. Only 1 T of cornstarch needed to thicken. Yummy!!
Great! I followed the recipe exactly as is I added chicken, shrimp, and broccoli. it was AMAZING
Awesome! Made it with home made pasta and it was a huge crowd pleaser!!!

I cook the seafood separately so as not to overcook. My take: Saute a bit of garlic in a pan with a stick of butter. Pour in a pint of heavy cream. After it starts getting good and hot add in a pinch of chicken boullion powder (flavor boost) and then start adding the cheese in a handful at a time til incorporated stirring continually and careful not to boil. Throw the cooked seafood in when its done (or keep separate) and serve with the pasta. No fail, perfect alfredo and tastes just like the good restaurants make.
I added fresh mushrooms and spinach while sautéing onions and garlic. I also cut the recipe in half. Delicious!
This was a fabulous dish - absolutely delicious. The only change I made was to use pappardelle noodles because I prefer them over fettuccine. Thanks for sharing!

Excellent! The half and half made it lighter than recipes that use whole cream. As others have noted, I added some sliced baby portobello mushrooms and a dash of white wine with the onion and garlic step. I also added a can of baby clams and a drop of clam juice with the fish step. For the cornstarch part, I spooned some sauce from the pan into a coffee cup. To this cup of warm sauce, I added 1 Tablespoon of cornstarch and dissolved it before adding it back to the pan. I waited to see the sauce consistency, then did the step one more time. It was perfect and no lumps of cornstarch.
This recipe is very good, but had to add extra Parmesan.
My husband loved it and he is one very picky eater. Added a bit more garlic and Ms. Dash Onion Herb Seasoning.
Add mushroom, parsley, broccoli, red pepper flakes, white wine
Follow rep to a T. Big hit with my family of picky eaters. By the time I remembered to take a pic, it was gone! Will cook this again!
The cream curdled for me.
Absolutely delicious! Paired with a nice chardonnay.
Awesome and delishes

I chose this recipe because it listed both shrimp and scallops in the ingredients, and I had never cooked scallops before. Result---ABSOLUTELY MOUTHWATERINGLY FANTASTIC!! I used half-n-half instead of the heavy cream, and perhaps that's why the sauce took a while to thicken, even with adding corn starch. Regardless, kudos to the chef and thank you!
Awesome dish! First time making it.My Family really enjoyed this dish. I used just a little more half and half. We definitely make again. Next, time we are going to add some crawfish.
I didn't have scallops so I used chicken I also doubled up the sauce. This was excellent and will become a favorite of mine.thanks

Loved this recipe. We were pleased with the great flavor. I used the full cup of Parmesan cheese while cooking and then added more when it was served. Also, made this with shrimp, King crab and one small lobster tail. Delicious!!!!
Very good. We loved it. I made as directed and it turned out great. Next time I will add fresh mushrooms and some wine for a little added flavor. Thank you for sharing.
Wonderful recipe! I used heavy cream instead of the half & half and also added a few slices of bacon. We had no leftovers. Will definitely make again.

Excellent recipe. Very easy to make and very flavorful. The sauce was creamy and had the right consistency. I used the tablespoon of cornstarch and once mixed with the pasta it was perfect. I added Portabella mushrooms. I used the 4 serving recipe instead of 8 and still had leftovers.

This was really easy to make and quite tasty! I added chopped red pepper when I added the onion and garlic into the pan, and omitted scallops. I had no idea how easy it is to make a white sauce seafood pasta dish. Will definitely add this into my usual dinner menus! Want to try chicken next time.
It's very tasty! My daughter loves it!

Instead of 2 cups of half and half, I used 1 1/2 cups of heavy cream and 1/2 cup of butter. Instead of 1 cup of onions, I use 1/4 cup of shallots. I used snow crab instead of scallops, this time around, but either work well. At the end I add the zest of 1 lemon and the juice as well. If you let the warm pasta sit in the sauce (without the seafood) for about 10 minutes, the pasta will soak it up and make it creamy.
This recipe is soooooo good! The family ranted and raved about it. So easy, I can't believe that people pay big bucks for alfredo when it's so easy! Definitely in the rotation.

Very easy & tasty. I halved the recipe since there are only 3 of us & I used bay scallops instead of sea scallops, since that's what I had on hand. I did include the corn starch to thicken the sauce & it came out great. Next time, I'll add a bit more garlic and maybe a little white wine just to take it up a notch. There will definitely be a next time!

This is an excellent base to work from. I made several changes, and we fought over leftovers the next 2 days. I added mushrooms, green pepper, 1/2 cup white wine and a squirt of fresh lemon juice. I reserved liquid from thawing sea scallops and added this, which I reduced before adding heavy cream. We had a lot of seafood, so the extra liquid was fine. I used the cornstarch. Perfect thickness for such a rich sauce. Served over penne pasta with Caesar salads, fresh green beans and garlic Parmesan toast rounds.
Tempting to gorge, but the richness calls for restraint...which leads to leftovers! Reheated without needing to add liquids.
Fairly easy and quite tasty. I made it a bit healthier by substituting yogurt and a little water for the half-and-half.

Just made this. I followed the directions except added 1/4 c of white wine to add flavor. I let it cook down after I added the cornstarch for about 10 minutes. I plan to toss with broccoli and pasta. thanks.
I am just picking up the "art" of cooking. I followed this recipe and thickened up the sauce just as the recipe recommended! My family thought I had gotten it from Olive Garden!!
This was a huge hit at our house a few weeks ago. I'm making it again today as our daughter is home from college. I doubled the recipe and used chicken and shrimp. Everyone loved it!

1/2 lb spagh, 1/2 lb scallops, 1/2 lb shrimp, 1/3 c romano, pressed garlic, 3 T butter 1/2 c half and half, 2 green onions, 1T cornstarch

DELICIOUS
